attributes.action: Tax foreign non-resident ownership of property
attributes.additional_details: Property prices particularly in central london are again rising rapidly, well above the ability of even skilled professional workers to afford them.   This is driven by two factors: shortage of supply and secondly, but no less importantly, the foreign ownership of property as an investment.  Currently around 3/4 of properties in London that cost above £1000/sq foot are bought by foreigners.  A considerable number of foreign buyers are not actually resident in this country.   I am proposing an annual levy of say £50 per square foot on companies and foreign citizens (in particular outside the EU) who own residential property in London and across the country, with a greater sum levied on those properties left unoccupied.
